description: Hunger kills more people each year than AIDS, malaria and terrorism combined. Over 820 million people worldwide suffer from hunger, according to the Food and Agriculture Organization of the United Nations (FAO).
Every 10 seconnds, a child dies from hunger
82% of hungry people live in countries with food surpluses, not food shortages
One in every eight people sleeps hungry each night
One third of the food produced around the world is never consumed

Sustainable development goals, such as zero hunger and no poverty, aim to address the root causes of hunger, poverty, and food wastage through collaborative efforts at the global, national, and local levels.
Hunger and poverty disproportionately affect women and children, who often bear the brunt of food insecurity's consequences.
